ground_truth_reviews.comment: The current implementation of `asyncio.gather` does not handle exceptions from individual tasks. If any call to `_verify_post_exists` fails (e.g., if a post is not found), the exception will propagate immediately, causing the entire batch operation to fail and return a 500 error. This prevents the successful verification of other posts in the batch. To make this endpoint more resilient, you should use `await asyncio.gather(*tasks, return_exceptions=True)` and then process the results list, which will contain either the successful results or the exception objects for failed tasks.

title: feat: Add batch post verification endpoint
body: This change introduces a new endpoint `/posts/batch-verify` to allow clients to check for the existence of multiple posts in a single request. The verifications are performed concurrently for better performance.
